clintock:BindKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Binding a nucleobase puts it in your first empty slot, consuming a pentose sugar and phosphate in the process. If you have no empty slots, an amino acid forms from the nucleotides and joins the peptide chain.

clintock:CytosineKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Deals damage to a random enemy.

clintock:FluorophoreKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Increases the potency of bound nucleobases.

clintock:Nucleobase.DESCRIPTION: Fundamental units of the genetic code found in DNA (adenine, cytosine, guanine, thymine).

clintock:DeoxyriboseKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Sugar derived from ribose. NL Essential molecule in generating nucleotides.

clintock:PhosphateKeyword.DESCRIPTION: Phosphorus bound to 4 oxygen residues. NL Essential molecule in generating nucleotides.
